channel.title: Doozie JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DOOZWEB-8] [create account] As a user, I can create a new Doozer account
item.description:
• If unauthenticated user, show them a screen with a set of fields to create a new account

controls for sign-up:

  • "Name" (required - 1 text box field)
  • "Email" (required - 1 textbox field; used as user-name for login)
  • "Password" and "Retype password" (2 text boxes for duplicating password for confirmation - use password control where characters are dotted-out)
  • "Create account" button

labels

  • the text input boxes show the label text above as inline text (aka "hint text" inside the box).
  • this text shows whenever the box is empty (even if focus is in the box).
  • it disappears as soon as the user enters text in the box, and it reappears if the user clears all text in the box.

Need to validate the following at the time focus leaves the control:

  • Name field has a string of any length entered in it
  • email field is in a valid email format
  • 2 password boxes match exactly, including letter case

if these conditions are not met when focus moves out of the control, show a warning string next to (or below if no space) the appropriate field:

  • "Please enter your name."
  • "Oops, that's not a valid email address."
  • "Oops, those 2 passwords don't match."
  • The warning string disappears when focus goes back into the control

if the user clicks the 'create account' button before all fields are filled out and validated:

  • show all relevant warning strings from above (if they're not already visible), and stay on the page

when the user clicks the button with all fields valid:

  • navigate to an interim page asking the user to check their email and click the link to validate their account
    "Your tasks are personal. We want to make sure it's really you before you enter all your tasks. Please check your email address (<email they entered>) for an email from Doozer and click the link to confirm your account."
  • send an email to the email address asking them to click a link and finish creating their account:
    "Hi <name entered in form>,
    Welcome to Doozer! Simplify your life and get more done. To get started, confirm your account by clicking this link: <confirmation link>"

Once the account is validated, navigate to the default app location (for now, the single list)
item.summary: [create account] As a user, I can create a new Doozer account

item.title: [DOOZWEB-9] [login] As a user with an existing doozer account, I can login with my email and password
item.description:
Amend the create account screen, with the following controls:

  • a header for the create account fields titled "Sign up"
  • a link "Sign in" below the "create account" button

Selecting "Sign in" causes the following things to happen (simultaneously):

  • the sign-up controls collapse under the "Sign up" header (slide animation)
  • the "Sign up" header turns into a link
  • The "Sign in" link turns into a header with the same text
  • the sign-in controls expand under the header (slide animation)

sign-in includes the following controls:

  • "Email" input box
  • "Password" input box (use a password control where characters are dotted-out)
  • "Keep me signed in" check box (checked by default) (note: this is specific to the web UI, not shown in the iOS mockup)
  • "Sign in" button

sign in button:

  • If clicking sign in button and the creds aren't a valid account (for any reason - empty fields, wrong email or wrong password), show a warning text above the button, "Sorry, we can't find that account. Please try again."
  • if clicking the sign in button with valid creds, navigate to default place in doozer (for now, single list).

Other behavior:

  • the text input boxes show the label text above as inline text (aka "hint text" inside the box). this text shows whenever the box is empty (even if focus is in the box). it disappears as soon as the user enters text in the box, and it reappears if the user clears all text in the box.
  • whichever state is expanded (sign in or sign up), the first input box has focus
  • If keep-signed-in checked, save the credentials to automatically login for this browser on this device.
item.summary: [login] As a user with an existing doozer account, I can login with my email and password

item.title: [DOOZWEB-10] [facebook login] As a new user, I can create an account with Facebook connect as my login
item.description:
• If unauthenticated user, show them a screen with a button to login with Facebook (use standard Facebook assets/icons for this)
  • Clicking the button launches the standard Facebook oauth hosted web flow to authenticate with a FB account
  • for now, we don't need to request any special permissions - just the basics we get "for free" (in the future we can amend with permissions for posting on their behalf or getting friends list, etc)
  • on web CORE work, make sure that the token is 'kept alive' as long as possible. the user should only need to re-sign-in if they choose to sign out.
item.summary: [facebook login] As a new user, I can create an account with Facebook connect as my login

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [DOOZWEB-11] [List] As a user, I can view a list of items
item.description:
basic list layout with:
1. title bar

  • List name (for now, put "Doozer" as default list name)
  • menu button - use the standard "hamburger" menu icon
  • menu button opens a menu - for now, this menu has 1 item: "Sign out" - which takes the user back to the sign in/sign up screen and removes all saved credentials for this user.

2. scrolling column of items

  • for scrolling, just show the full list on the page, so that user uses the scrollbar that's part of the browser all the way on the right of the window (and automatically get scrollwheel etc... in other words, don't put a scrollbar within the list control itself)
  • each item on its own line, text of item left aligned (with margin)
  • the titlebar stays fixed on screen while scrolling
item.summary: [List] As a user, I can view a list of items

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [DOOZWEB-12] [new item] As a user, I can create a new item in a list
item.description:
(SEE MOCKUP LINK)

  • new item text box (aka edit box) at the top of the list (always above the first item in the list)
    • when the user navigates to the list, focus begins in the new item box, so immediate typing can add a new item
    • the hint text of the box says "New item..." (in italics). the hint remains visible while there are no characters entered in the edit box.
    • the height and width of the new item edit box is the same size as each item in the list
  • interaction with new item edit box:
    • ENTER commits the new item (see below) and leaves focus in the now empty new item box
    • ESC clears the new item field and leaves focus in the now empty box (without adding the typed item to the list)
    • Scrolling the list OR clicking anywhere outside the new item box commits the new item. focus may remain in the box only if the place where the mouse clicked didn't take focus away.
    • trying to commit or clear an empty new item box does nothing. however, any character, even a single space, can be committed as a new item
  • committing a new item:
    • the new item is always added as the very first item in the list.
  • new item edit box scrolls off with the list
    • when the user opens the list, it starts at the very top of the list, with the new item edit box on screen above the first item in the list, below the title bar.
    • as the user scrolls down in the list, the new item box scrolls off screen as part of the list (just as if it's the first item in the list - scrolling with the list).
    • to get back to the new item box, the user needs to scroll back to the top of the list where the new item box lives.
item.summary: [new item] As a user, I can create a new item in a list

item.title: [DOOZWEB-13] [complete item] As a user, I can mark an item completed, so it no longer shows in my list
item.description:
[SEE MOCKUP LINK]

  • completing an item
    • any item in the list can be marked completed by right clicking anywhere on the item
  • item fading out to completed state
    • as soon as the user marks an item completed (right-clicks), it starts fading out over a span of 2 seconds*, with a linear change in transparency
      • and (at the same time it starts fading out), a checkmark icon appears on the left side of the item (justified with left edge, before the text of the item)
    • if the user interacts with the item at all while it is fading out, the completed state change is canceled. The item returns to full opacity, the checkmark disappears, and the item remains in-place.
      • user interactions that cancel a mark-completed-action include: click or right click on the item, drag the item, or pressing ENTER or ESC while focus is on the item.
        • if the interaction was a click or ENTER, then the item both changes to uncompleted & responds to the action (e.g. allows user to edit - coming in future story)
        • if the interaction was a drag, the item both changes to uncompleted & responds to the drag-to-rearrange action (coming in future story - rearrange)
        • if the interaction was a right-click or ESC, the item changes to uncompleted, but does not move or do anything else.
      • user interactions that do NOT cancel a completion: scrolling or interacting with a different item does NOT cancel or change the mark-completed-action or the fading animation
    • if the user scrolls the fading-to-completion item off screen, it immediately gets marked completed and removed from the list (nothing visible on screen changes, e.g. the scroll position doesn't change; however, the completed item will be gone if the user scrolls back to where it previously was fading out)
    • if the fade out time completes while the item is still on screen, the item has gone 100% transparent, and the items below the item slide up to take its place
  • items are not deleted from the server (stored for a future 'completed items' view)
    • while completed items no longer show in the list, they are still stored as part of a set of "completed items" per each list, with all the item's properties/history intact

*TWEAKABLE VARIABLES
1. completed item fading out time (default = 2 seconds)
item.summary: [complete item] As a user, I can mark an item completed, so it no longer shows in my list

item.title: [DOOZWEB-14] [switch list] As a user, I can jump to another list from anywhere in the app

  • displays menu of all the lists
  • start with 3 default lists: Personal, Work, Shopping
item.summary: [switch list] As a user, I can jump to another list from anywhere in the app

item.title: [DOOZWEB-20] [view completed] As a user, I can view all the completed items for a particular list, so that I can bring any back and undo the completion
item.description:
[SEE MOCKUP LINK]

  • Completed link:
    • at the very bottom of the list, a link is shown below the last item in the list
      • the link text is "View completed items"
      • the link appears centered in the screen, and in a space that's twice the height as an item in the list (but there is none of an item's visual treatment behind or around the link - it appears to be placed on the background "behind" the items, below the end of the list)
      • the link can't be moved/dragged or interacted with, except a tap/click
      • the link scrolls inline (at the same speed) with all the other items in the list
  • Completed items view
    • When the user clicks the completed items link, navigate to the completed items for this list - shows all the completed items that belong only to the current list
      • the completed items are sorted by time completed (most recently completed at the top)
    • there is no "new item edit box" in this list
    • the title bar changes:
      • the title is "Completed: <current list name>"
      • the back button takes the user back to the regular view of that list (uncompleted/active items)
    • scrolling works the same as regular lists (with the title bar scrolling off in the same way, except no 'new item box' is present)
  • Interacting with completed items:
    • right clicking on a completed item makes it go back to active/uncompleted state (aka 'marks active')
    • cannot change the sort order of the list - e.g. won't be able to drag/drop to move completed items around, even when we implement that for regular views
    • can view the properties of an item, but can't edit it - e.g. click will expand the item when we implement that story, but it will be in read only state.
  • transitioning to active state (un-completing items)
    • as soon as an item is marked active, it starts fading out of the completed list.
    • it behaves the same as an item transitioning to the completed state. (e.g. same fading out and same behaviors cancel the transition to active, to keep the item in the completed list)
      • However, instead of a checkmark icon next to the item's text, it shows an empty checkbox icon
item.summary: [view completed] As a user, I can view all the completed items for a particular list, so that I can bring any back and undo the completion

item.title: [DOOZWEB-24] [Groups] As a user, I can add groups to a list to see headers for chunks of items
item.description:
• choose from a set of available groups (default: 'now', 'soon', 'someday') - they show up as headers in the list
  • by default a list has only 1 group ("blank") which does not show in the UI as a header. even after users add groups to a list, items can belong to "blank" and show without a header (always at the top of the list?)
  • place / rearrange each group header in same way as rearranging items
  • can remove groups from a list (and all items in that group slide up to belong to the group above)
  • rearrange items to be within each group
item.summary: [Groups] As a user, I can add groups to a list to see headers for chunks of items

item.title: [DOOZWEB-29] [item privacy] As a user, I can choose which items are shared vs. private
item.description:
Needed more for future P3/stage 3 features around matching offers in community?? not shared lists?

  • by default items are "shared anonymously with community"
  • when a parent list is shared with others, all items change to "shared with <x> <y> <z> people"
  • item properties allows users to set items to "private" and they will be hidden from others on the shared list, as well as excluded from any anonymous matching
  • what if an item is set to private before sharing a whole list?
  • how do I know which items can be seen by others or not? (visual treatment? or simplify and can't hide once list is shared?)
item.summary: [item privacy] As a user, I can choose which items are shared vs. private

status.description: Doozer custom starting point for issues

• list level properties (accessed via titlebar): tags... others??
  • apply as defaults to all new items created for that list... does it change existing items?
item.summary: [Edit list properties] As a user, I can edit properties on the list level to apply to the overall list, or change the defaults of new items for that list

item.title: [DOOZIOS-13] [create account] As a user, I can create a new Doozer account
item.description:
• If unauthenticated user, show them a screen with a set of fields to create a new account

controls for sign-up:

  • "Name" (required - 1 text box field)
  • "Email" (required - 1 textbox field; used as user-name for login)
  • "Password" and "Retype password" (2 text boxes for duplicating password for confirmation - use password control where characters are dotted-out)
  • "Create account" button

labels

  • the text input boxes show the label text above as inline text (aka "hint text" inside the box).
  • this text shows whenever the box is empty (even if focus is in the box).
  • it disappears as soon as the user enters text in the box, and it reappears if the user clears all text in the box.

Need to validate the following at the time focus leaves the control:

  • Name field has a string of any length entered in it
  • email field is in a valid email format
  • 2 password boxes match exactly, including letter case

if these conditions are not met when focus moves out of the control, show a warning string next to (or below if no space) the appropriate field:

  • "Please enter your name."
  • "Oops, that's not a valid email address."
  • "Oops, those 2 passwords don't match."
  • The warning string disappears when focus goes back into the control

if the user clicks the 'create account' button before all fields are filled out and validated:

  • show all relevant warning strings from above (if they're not already visible), and stay on the page

when the user clicks the button with all fields valid:

  • navigate to an interim page asking the user to check their email and click the link to validate their account
    "Your tasks are personal. We want to make sure it's really you before you enter all your tasks. Please check your email address (<email they entered>) for an email from Doozer and click the link to confirm your account."
  • trigger the same confirmation email as the web client (see cloned story from web client)

Once the account is validated, navigate to the default app location (for now, the single list)

  • recheck auth on app resume/launch.
  • if the saved creds from this new account are now validated, go to the list.
  • if the creds are not yet validated, go to the sign-up screen (which will have sign-in included with the next user story)
item.summary: [create account] As a user, I can create a new Doozer account

item.title: [DOOZIOS-24] [login] As a user with an existing doozer account, I can login with my email and password
item.description:
Amend the create account screen, with the following controls:

  • a header for the create account fields titled "Sign up"
  • a link "Sign in" below the "create account" button

Selecting "Sign in" causes the following things to happen (simultaneously):

  • the sign-up controls collapse under the "Sign up" header (slide animation)
  • the "Sign up" header turns into a link
  • The "Sign in" link turns into a header with the same text
  • the sign-in controls expand under the header (slide animation)

sign-in includes the following controls:

  • "Email" input box
  • "Password" input box (use a password control where characters are dotted-out)
  • "Sign in" button

sign in button:

  • If clicking sign in button and the creds aren't a valid account (for any reason - empty fields, wrong email or wrong password), show a warning text above the button, "Sorry, we can't find that account. Please try again."
  • if clicking the sign in button with valid creds, navigate to default place in doozer (for now, single list).

Other behavior:

  • the text input boxes show the label text above inline - as "hint text" inside the box. this text shows whenever the box is empty (even if focus is in the box). it disappears as soon as the user enters text in the box, and it reappears if the user clears all text in the box.
  • whichever state is expanded (sign in or sign up), the first input box has focus
  • save the credentials to always automatically login for this device (until user chooses to sign-out).
item.summary: [login] As a user with an existing doozer account, I can login with my email and password

item.title: [DOOZIOS-10] [facebook login] As a new user, I can create an account with Facebook connect as my login
item.description:
• If unauthenticated user, show them a screen with a button to login with Facebook (use standard Facebook assets/icons for this)
  • Clicking the button launches the standard Facebook iOS SDK flow to authenticate with a FB account
  • for now, we don't need to request any special permissions - just the basics we get "for free" (in the future we can amend with permissions for posting on their behalf or getting friends list, etc)
  • make sure that the token is 'kept alive' as long as possible. the user should only need to re-sign-in if they choose to sign out.

item.title: [DOOZIOS-22] [List] As a user, I can view a list of items
item.description:
basic list layout with:
1. title bar

  • List name (for now, put "Doozer" as default list name)
  • menu button - use the standard "hamburger" menu icon
  • menu button opens a menu - for now, this menu has 1 item: "Sign out" - which takes the user back to the sign in/sign up screen and removes all saved credentials for this user.

2. scrolling column of items

  • basic pannable surface (e.g. standard panning indicator and panning interaction)
  • each item on its own line, text of item left aligned (with margin)
  • the titlebar stays fixed on screen while scrolling
item.summary: [List] As a user, I can view a list of items

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: What is a "basic pannable surface (e.g. standard panning indicator and panning interaction)"

Sorry for any confusion. A pannable surface is the same as a scrollable surface except that it's designed for touch interactions. In general, a panning surface and a scrolling surface are interchangeable / serve the same purpose. But, touch-first platforms should be doing some basic tailoring of scrolling surfaces so they work better for touch, and hence, I'm using terminology of "pannable surface" or "panning surface" or "panning indicator" to differentiate that this story is targeting a mobile platform (iOS in this case) and should be taking advantage of the platform's touch tailored experiences and controls.
Here are a couple examples of how platforms generally tailor a scrolling surface for touch... (NOTE: I'm NOT suggesting any of these things are work we do in our app - these are all things that should be coming from building on a mobile platform with touch-first controls)

  • re-skinning the scrollbar to become a "panning indicator" so that it's visually more lightweight (e.g. just a little bar on the edge, not a full scrollbar with arrow buttons) and is a visual indicator only, not interact-able.
  • implementing gesture-aware scrolling interactions, such as inertia & momentum based on the touch drag+release gesture

Please let me know if any of this is unclear, or if anyone has further questions.

item.title: [DOOZIOS-12] [new item] As a user, I can create a new item in a list
item.description:
(SEE MOCKUP LINK)

  • new item text box (aka edit box) at the top of the list (always above the first item in the list)
    • when the user navigates to the list, focus does not begin in the box (no keyboard shows up on first opening the list)
    • the hint text of the box says "New item" (in italics). the hint remains visible while there are no characters entered in the edit box.
    • the height and width of the new item edit box is the same size as each item in the list
  • interaction with new item edit box:
    • tapping in the new item box puts focus there and brings up the keyboard
    • ENTER from the touch keyboard commits the new item (see below) and leaves focus in the now empty new item box, with the keyboard still up, to enter another item
    • scrolling the list OR tapping anywhere outside the new item box commits the new item (unless the box is empty) and removes focus from the box/dismisses the keyboard
    • trying to commit an empty new item box does nothing. however, any character, even a single space, can be committed as a new item
  • committing a new item:
    • the new item is always added as the very first item in the list.
  • new item edit box scrolls off with the list
    • when the user opens the list, it starts at the very top of the list, with the new item edit box on screen above the first item in the list, below the title bar.
    • as the user scrolls down in the list, the new item box scrolls off screen as part of the list (just as if it's the first item in the list - scrolling with the list).
    • to get back to the new item box, the user needs to scroll back to the top of the list where the new item box lives.
item.summary: [new item] As a user, I can create a new item in a list

item.title: [DOOZIOS-31] [complete item] As a user, I can mark an item completed, so it no longer shows in my list
item.description:
[SEE MOCKUP LINK]

  • completing an item
    • any item in the list can be marked completed by swiping the item horizontally to the right (perpendicular to the scrolling direction)
      • Note: sliding the item to the left does nothing - the item doesn't move or respond in any way
    • as the user moves their finger to the right, the item follows the finger 1:1 in the horizontal direction. the item does not move in the vertical direction (locked on rails in the horizontal direction)
    • as the item moves to the right with the finger, it revels a large check mark underneath the item.
      • the checkmark icon is the same height as the item and twice as wide as tall*.
      • the checkmark starts out as a black icon on a white background.
      • when the item is moved far enough to reveal the full checkmark, the icon flips to white on a black background (to indicate the item has moved far enough to be completed)
      • if the user moves the item back to the left before letting go, starting to cover the checkmark once again, the checkmark flips back to its original state of black icon on white background
    • the item moves, stuck to the finger, until it has moved to the edge of the checkmark - or a distance equal to twice the height of items* – after that distance, it no longer moves if the finger continues to move right. However, it will still follow the finger if the finger reverses and moves to the left (up until the edge of the screen, the original position of the item).
    • if the finger lets go while the checkmark is flipped (the item is currently moved far enough right to reveal the full checkmark), the item transitions into completed state. it slides back to its original position, and starts fading out (see below)
    • if the finger lets go while the checkmark is not yet flipped (the item is not moved far enough right), then it slides back to original position, but does not change state.
  • item transitioning to completed state via fade out
    • as soon as the user marks an item completed (releasing after dragging past the threshold), the item:
      • slides back into place
      • and then (after it's slid back in place), starts fading out over a span of 2 seconds*, with a linear change in transparency
      • and (at the same time it starts fading out, after having slid back into place), a checkmark icon appears on the left side of the item (justified with left edge, before the text of the item)
    • if the user interacts with the item at all while it is fading out, the completed state change is canceled. The item returns to full opacity, the checkmark disappears, and the item remains in-place.
      • user interactions that cancel a mark-completed-action include: tap the item, press & hold on the item, or swipe the item horizontally in either direction.
        • as soon as the user presses on the item (for tap, press, or drag), the completed state is canceled and it immediately returns to full opacity and the checkmark is removed
        • if the interaction was a tap, then the item both changes to uncompleted & responds to the tap action (e.g. allows user to edit - coming in future story)
        • if the interaction was a press & hold, the item both changes to uncompleted & responds to the rearrange action (coming in future story - rearrange)
        • if the interaction was a horizontal drag, the item changes to uncompleted, but does not move horizontally at all.
      • user interactions that do NOT cancel a completion: scrolling (even if the finger is over the completed item when it starts dragging for scrolling) or interacting with a different item does NOT cancel or change the mark-completed-action or the fading animation
    • if the user scrolls the fading-to-completion item off screen, it immediately gets removed from the list (nothing visible on screen changes, e.g. the scroll position doesn't change; however, the completed item will be gone if the user scrolls back to where it previously was fading out)
    • if the fade out time completes while the item is still on screen, the item has gone 100% transparent, and the items below the completed item slide up to take its place
  • items are not deleted from the server (they are stored for a future 'completed items' view)
    • while completed items no longer show in the list, they are still stored as part of a set of "completed items" per each list, with all the item's properties/history intact

*TWEAKABLE VARIABLES
1. completed item fading out time (default = 2 seconds)
2. distance an item can move horizontally (default = twice the height of an item)
– this variable is also used for: (a) width of checkmark icon, and (b) the horizontal distance an item needs to move to go into completed state
item.summary: [complete item] As a user, I can mark an item completed, so it no longer shows in my list

item.summary: [switch list] As a user, I can jump to another list from anywhere in the app

item.title: [DOOZIOS-15] [view completed] As a user, I can view all the completed items for a particular list, so that I can bring any back and undo the completion
item.description:
[SEE MOCKUP LINK]

  • Completed link:
    • at the very bottom of the list, a link is shown below the last item in the list
      • the link text is "View completed items"
      • the link appears centered in the screen, and in a space that's the twice the height as an item in the list (but there is none of an item's visual treatment behind or around the link - it appears to be placed on the background "behind" the items, below the end of the list)
      • the link can't be moved/dragged or interacted with, except a tap
      • the link scrolls inline (at the same speed) with all the other items in the list
  • Completed items view
    • When the user taps the completed items link, navigate to the completed items for this list - shows all the completed items that belong only to the current list list
      • the completed items are sorted by time completed (most recently completed at the top)
    • there is no "new item edit box" in this list
    • the title bar changes:
      • the title is "Completed: <current list name>"
      • the back button takes the user back to the regular view of that list (uncompleted/active items)
    • scrolling works the same as regular lists (with the title bar scrolling off in the same way, except no 'new item box' is present)
  • Interacting with completed items:
    • dragging the completed item to the right to the threshold distance (same as marking items completed) makes it go back to active/uncompleted state (aka 'marks active'). the interaction is the same as completing an item.
      • dragging a completed item reveals the same checkmark icon underneath as in the completing action. however, the checkmark starts out in completed state (white icon on black background) and flips to uncompleted (black icon on white background) when the item passes the threshold.
    • cannot change the sort order of the list - e.g. press & hold, drag/drop won't work in completed views even when we implement it in regular views.
    • can view the properties of an item, but can't edit it - e.g. tap will expand the item when we implement that story, but it will be in read only state.
  • transitioning to active state (un-completing items)
    • as soon as an item is marked active (dragged passed threshold & released), it slides back in place and starts fading out of the completed list.
    • it behaves the same as an item transitioning to the completed state. (e.g. same fading out and same behaviors cancel the transition to active, to keep the item in the completed list).
      • However, instead of a checkmark icon next to the item's text, it shows an empty checkbox icon
item.summary: [view completed] As a user, I can view all the completed items for a particular list, so that I can bring any back and undo the completion

item.title: [DOOZIOS-16] [item privacy] As a user, I can choose which items are shared vs. private
item.description:
Only needed in future P3/stage 3 features around matching offers in community?? not needed for shared lists?

  • by default items are "shared anonymously with community"
  • when a parent list is shared with others, all items change to "shared with <x> <y> <z> people"
  • item properties allows users to set items to "private" and they will be hidden from others on the shared list, as well as excluded from any anonymous matching
  • what if an item is set to private before sharing a whole list?
  • how do I know which items can be seen by others or not? (visual treatment? or simplify and can't hide once list is shared?)
item.summary: [item privacy] As a user, I can choose which items are shared vs. private

item.title: [DOOZIOS-43] [new item- fancy] As a user, I can access the new item box from anywhere in the list so I don't have to return to the top to add a new item
item.description:
• new item box floats just below the title bar (instead of at the top of the items in the list)
  • committing a new item:
    • the new item is added to the spot at the top of the currently visible set of items (e.g. the scroll position at the top of the current view).
    • If an existing item is partially visible on screen, the new item is added just after that partially visible item.
    • a new item is added with a sliding animation - the new item slides down from the edit box into position at the top of the currently visible set of items. At the same time, all the subsequent items lower in the list slide down together to make room (and the bottom most item slides off screen).
  • new item edit box scrolls off with the list (and the title bar)
    • when the user opens the list, it starts at the very top of the list, with the new item edit box on screen above the first item in the list, below the title bar.
    • as the user scrolls down in the list, the title bar and the new item box scroll off screen as a unit, with slight parallax (a slower rate than the scrolling rate of the list items):
      • the first items in the list scroll up and underneath the title bar & new item box.
      • as soon as the list items start scrolling up and off screen, the title bar + new item box unit scroll up as well. however, the title bar+new item box scroll at half the speed of the list items*. (so in the distance/time that it takes to scroll 4 list items, the title bar+new item box are fully off screen)
      • Once the title bar + new item box are fully off screen, the list continues to scroll further in the same direction seamlessly
      • if the scrolling of list items stops when either title bar or new item box are partially off screen, then they continue moving up to snap into place so the partially cutoff control is fully off screen (leaving visible either the new item box only, or neither).
        • the items in the list are unaffected by the controls snapping off screen; the controls move as a layer on top of the list items... UNLESS, it leaves a gap of empty space above the first list item. in this case, the list items scroll up at the same time as the title bar/new item box snapping off screen, until the first item in the list is edge-to-edge with the new item box or the top of the screen.
  • new item text box (and the title bar) comes back as an overlay as soon as the user scrolls in the reverse direction, towards the top of the list
    • as the user scrolls up in the list (list items coming down into view), the title bar + new item box scroll down into view as a unit, at half the speed of the list items' scrolling rate*, as an overlay on top of the list items
    • if the scrolling of list items stops when either title bar or new item box are partially on screen, then they continue moving down into view to snap into place so that the full control is on screen (leaving visible either the new item box only, or both)
      • the items in the list are unaffected by the controls snapping off screen; the controls move as a layer on top of the list items.

*TWEAKABLE VARIABLES
1. "Title + new item scroll speed", as fraction of list item scroll speed (default = 0.5)
item.summary: [new item- fancy] As a user, I can access the new item box from anywhere in the list so I don't have to return to the top to add a new item

item.title: [DOOZWEB-96] [new item- fancy] As a user, I can access the new item box from anywhere in the list so I don't have to return to the top to add a new item
item.description:
• new item box floats just below the title bar (instead of at the top of the items in the list)
  • committing a new item:
    • the new item is added to the spot at the top of the currently visible set of items (e.g. the scroll position at the top of the current view).
    • If an existing item is partially visible on screen, the new item is added just after that partially visible item.
    • a new item is added with a sliding animation - the new item slides down from the edit box into position at the top of the currently visible set of items. At the same time, all the subsequent items lower in the list slide down together to make room (and the bottom most item slides off screen).
  • new item edit box scrolls off with the list (and the title bar)
    • when the user opens the list, it starts at the very top of the list, with the new item edit box on screen above the first item in the list, below the title bar.
    • as the user scrolls down in the list, the title bar and the new item box scroll off screen as a unit, with slight parallax (a slower rate than the scrolling rate of the list items):
      • the first items in the list scroll up and underneath the title bar & new item box.
      • as soon as the list items start scrolling up and off screen, the title bar + new item box unit scroll up as well. however, the title bar+new item box scroll at half the speed of the list items*. (so in the distance/time that it takes to scroll 4 list items, the title bar+new item box are fully off screen)
      • Once the title bar + new item box are fully off screen, the list continues to scroll further in the same direction seamlessly
      • if the scrolling of list items stops when either title bar or new item box are partially off screen, then they continue moving up to snap into place so the partially cutoff control is fully off screen (leaving visible either the new item box only, or neither).
        • the items in the list are unaffected by the controls snapping off screen; the controls move as a layer on top of the list items... UNLESS, it leaves a gap of empty space above the first list item. in this case, the list items scroll up at the same time as the title bar/new item box snapping off screen, until the first item in the list is edge-to-edge with the new item box or the top of the screen.
  • new item text box (and the title bar) comes back as an overlay as soon as the user scrolls in the reverse direction, towards the top of the list
    • as the user scrolls up in the list (list items coming down into view), the title bar + new item box scroll down into view as a unit, at half the speed of the list items' scrolling rate*, as an overlay on top of the list items
    • if the scrolling of list items stops when either title bar or new item box are partially on screen, then they continue moving down into view to snap into place so that the full control is on screen (leaving visible either the new item box only, or both)
      • the items in the list are unaffected by the controls snapping off screen; the controls move as a layer on top of the list items.

*TWEAKABLE VARIABLES
1. "Title + new item scroll speed", as fraction of list item scroll speed (default = 0.5)
item.summary: [new item- fancy] As a user, I can access the new item box from anywhere in the list so I don't have to return to the top to add a new item
